enWisdom: Keeping oneself hungry is the most beneficial cure
Decrease your [consumption of] food and your ailments will reduce
Fitness of the body is [in] abstinence from [harmful] foods

Wisdom: قِلَّةُ الْأَكْلِ يَمْنَعُ كَثِيراً مِنَ أَعْلَالِ الْجِسْمِ
enWisdom: Eating less prevents many maladies of the body

Wisdom: قِلَّةُ الْغِذَاءِ أَكْرَمُ لِلنَّفْسِ وَأَدْوَمُ لِلصِّحَّةِ
enWisdom: Eating less food is more honorable for the soul and makes good health last longer
Whoever eats less, his aches [and ailments] are reduced
Whoever eats less, his thoughts become pure

Wisdom: مَنْ قَلَّتْ [خقت‏] طُعْمَتُهُ خَفَّتْ عَلَيْهِ مَئُونَتُهُ
enWisdom: Whoever consumes less, [the burden of] his sustenance is lightened

Wisdom: مَنِ اقْتَصَرَ فِي أَكْلِهِ كَثُرَتْ صِحَّتُهُ وَصَلَحَتْ فِكْرَتُهُ
enWisdom: One who restricts his eating, his health improves and his thoughts become righteous

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَصْبِرْ عَلَى مَضَضِ الْحِمْيَةِ طَالَ سُقْمُهُ
enWisdom: One who cannot patiently bear the agony of abstinence [from food], his sickness will be prolonged
How good an assistant of piety hunger is!

Wisdom: نِعْمَ الْعَوْنُ عَلَى أَشَرِ [أَسْرِ] النَّفْسِ وَكَسْرِ عَادَتِهَا التَّجَوُّعُ
enWisdom: How good an assistant in cutting down the [desires of the carnal] self and breaking its [bad] habits hunger is!
